intro: Thelymitra planicola, commonly known as the flat-leaf rock orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Australia. It is characterized by its small, flat leaves and delicate, greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in heathland or woodland habitats. Thelymitra planicola is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its relatively simple floral structure. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
